content.text: There are many JavaScript array methods.
One of the most useful in React is the .map() array method.
content.html: One of the most useful in React is the .map() array method.

content.text: The .map() method allows you to run a function on each item in the array, returning a new array as the result.
content.html: The .map() method allows you to run a function on each item in the array, returning a new array as the result.

content.text: In React, map() can be used to generate lists.
content.html: In React, map() can be used to generate lists.

content.code:
const
myArray
=

[
'apple'
,

'banana'
,

'orange'
]
;



const
myList
=
myArray
.
map
(
(
item
)

=>

<
p
>
{
item
}
</
p
>
)
content.code_html:
const myArray = ['apple', 'banana', 'orange'];

const myList = myArray.map((item) => <p>{item}</p>)

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct statement of the array map() method?
content.html: What is a correct statement of the array map() method?

metadata.question: What is a correct statement of the array map() method?

options.text: The map() method is used to hold map coordinates
The map() method is used to generate maps
The map() method is used to run a function on every item in an array
